titleStmt.title: Istanbul, Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi), E. H. 26 [= Karatay 33]

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

msContents.summary:
22 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 26; Text: Q 41:9-40, Q 18:97-109, Q 20:102-107, Q 20:120-123, Q 30:34-37, Q 11:3-5, Q 10:83-93; 5-7 lines per page; Dimensions: 320 x 224 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 750-900.
This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages.
The folios 14 - 19 originally belonged to the same codex as the following fragments:
For more information, as well as a detailed overview of all parts of this codex, please visit the "Digital Muṣḥaf" created by Keith Small.
Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, pp. 12-13: "33 E. H. 26 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 224mm boy ve 320mm eninde cönk şeklinde 22 yaprak. Sahifede II-III. (VIII-IX) asır kûfîsi ile 190mm uzunl.[uğunda] 7 satır. Bazı yapraklarını kurtlar tahrip etmiştir. Y. 21b de müzehhep salbekli bir çerçeve vardır. Miklepli koyu kahve rengi deri cilt. Bu ciltte: Y. 1a Fuṣṣilat (41) surenin 9. ayetinin son kelimesi olan العالمين den başlar, ayni surenin 40. ayetinde ما شئتمkelimesine kadar devam eder; Y. 14a da Kehf (18) suresinin 97. ayetinden başlıyarak ayni surenin 109. ayetinin sonunda biter; Y. 18a Ṭāhā (20) surenin 102. ayetten başlıyarak 107. ayetin başında biter; Y. 19a da ayni suresinin 120. ayetinden 123. ayetine kadar devam eder; Y. 20a Rūm (30) suresinin 34. ayetinden 37. ayetin sonlarında biter. Y. 21a Hūd (11) suresinin 3. ayetinden başlayıp 5. ayetinin sonunda biter. Y. 22a da Yunus (10) suresinin 83. ayetinden başlar ve 93. ayetin sonlarında biter. Bu mushaftaki yapraklar muhtelif ellerden yazılmış olup sonradan toplanmıştır."
This can be translated as follows: "33 E. H. 26 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 22 junk shaped leaves of 224 mm height and 320 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd(8th-9th) centuries [contains] 7 lines measuring 190 mm. Some leaves are worm-eaten. On L. 21b, there is an illuminated border with salbek. Dark brown leather binding with flap (miklep). In this fragment: L. 1a begins with العالمين, the last word of Q 41 (Sūra Fuṣṣilat) and ends with the word ما شئتم of verse 40 of the same sūra. L. 14a begins with Q 18:97 (Sūra al-Kahf) and ends at the end of the verse 109 of the same sūra. L. 18a begins with Q 20:102 (Sūra Ṭāhā) and ends at the beginning of verse 107. L. 19a continues from verse 120 to 123 of the same sūra. L. 20a begins with Q 30:34 (Sūra al-Rūm) and ends at the end of verse 37. L. 21a begins with Q 11:3 (Sūra Hūd) and ends at the end of verse 5. L. 22a begins with Q 10:83 (Sūra Yūnus) and ends towards the end of verse 93. The leaves in this codex were copied by various hands and were collected later."
